name: Novotel Darwin Atrium

reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel located opposite lovely Bicentennial Park and the ocean. Unfortunately we didn't have an ocean view (even though we had requested one). Can never understand how that works as the hotel was only semi-full! Anyway, had upgraded to a superior room which was very nice and roomy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't eat at the hotel as there are many nice restaurants within walking distance. Pool area was nice as well. Loved the location but may stay across the road at the Saville next time, purely for the fact that their rooms have balconies and it would be lovely to sit out on the balcony on the balmy nights.
reviews.title: Great Darwin service

reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it's important to bear in mind that the standard of Darwin accommodation is very different to that of Melbourne or Sydney. The Novotel certainly isn't as glamorous as what you might find in one of those cities but we really enjoyed the stay regardless.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was great, I think it was recently renovated and was really lovely. The bathroom could do with a renovation and had a bit of mildew in the shower recess though is expected being in the tropics. The one BIG criticism I could make was that there were no balconies unless you were in a corner room. The actual window is quite small but the view was magnificent.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — The cocktail bar closed too early!

reviews.title: Welcome to Travelodge - Darwin
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight on our way to Kakadu National Park (which my wife and I would recommend).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To put it bluntly the hotel and the room were average and expensive (over $200AU). The room is average size, has poor bathroom facilities and a very poor, unsupportive bed. The hotel provides no internet access above the lobby floor and wifi access is very expensive.
reviews.title: Good hotel with great location

likes.liked: — Location to CBD and ocean views

reviews.text: On the plus side there is free parking and a nice pool area - food is very average. The hotel is centrally located for Darwin but that is not necessarily a good thing - a tour of the town can be easily accomplished in a couple of hours (it is hardly a sprawling metropolis!)
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

reviews.text: The highlights of our stay were Cullen Bay (lovely village atmosphere with great views and restuarants) and the Mindal Beach Market (Thurs / Sun - truly a one-off/must-see).My advice, hire a car and stay in Cullen Bay and kick back and enjoy the luxury - then go and explore the Northern Territory.
reviews.title: It was ok!!
Not a bad little hotel....
reviews.text: To put the Atrium in context all the hotels on this strip look to deliver the same standards of accommdation / service - don't expect city standards of luxury compared to Sydney / Brisbane etc... you will be very disappointed.

description: The Novotel Darwin Atrium is conveniently located in the city centre, overlooking Darwin Harbour. This 4 star hotel is a short stroll from the dining and entertainment precinct of Mitchell Street and is equally suited to business trips and holidays. Boasting 140 spacious rooms and conference facilities, the Novotel Atrium features a magnificent tropical indoor rainforest, complete with cascading vines and palm trees. Try our famous cocktails in the bar, or enjoy a delicious meal in our restaurant.
